title: WIC and chapter 7
question: We're getting Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) assistance. Do we have to disclose this to file Chapter 7 ?
answers:
I am assuming you don't have the money to get an attorney. If that is the case, Public Counsel has a great program for people who can't afford their own attorneys. They have a 4 hour class that teaches yo how to file every other Tuesday in their offices in Korea Town; there is a subway nearby and a bus stop and everything (this is called the bankruptcy pro se clinic)

They also have a bankruptcy self help desk every monday and wednesday, 10 am to 12 and 2 to 4 pm right inside the federal courthouse building (across the way from the bankruptcy courthouses).

Attorneys volunteer there and I'm sure they will check your exemptions etc out for you for free. I've included a link for more info.

Yes, disclose it. But take advantage of the pro bono legal help, free legal help that these other attorneys have referred you to. There may be something else that you are missing, and it could really make your filing turn into a nightmare.

Yes, but not an issue. However, I would suggest speaking with an Attorney prior to filing. If you cannot afford an Attorney contact your local Bankruptcy court.

All the Bankruptcy courts in the Los Angeles area have a free legal aid clinic. I know, I volunteer at the one in the San Fernando Valley.



Jonathan Leventhal, Esq..
Leventhal Law Group, P.C.
818-347-5800

NO EX-PARTE NOTICE VIA VOICE MAIL OR EMAIL: I do not accept e-mail notice for ex parte Applications via voicemail or by email. You must comply with California Law and give notice to a person in my office during regular business hours.

This email and any attachments thereto may contain private, confidential, and privileged material for the sole use of the intended recipient. Any review, copying, or distribution of this email (or any attachments thereto) by others is strictly prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender immediately and permanently delete the original and any copies of this email and any attachments thereto.

Leventhal Law Group, P.C. is a Debt Relief Agency under federal law.

Note: The Leventhal Law Group, P.C. does not represent you until a written fee agreement has been signed by you and a representative of the Leventhal Law Group, P.C. and all fees listed in the agreement have been paid.
Yes, but it should not hurt your ability to qualify for a Chapter 7.
Disclosure is required, but it is exempt and not considered income.
